title: David Walliams unveiled as NTAs 2020 host to celebrate 25th anniversary

Britain's Got Talent judge David Walliams will host the star-studded National Television Awards in January 2020.

Dermot O'Leary has presented the annual ceremony from The O2 Arena since 2010 after taking over from Trevor McDonald.

Walliams will now present the 25th anniversary show and he is no stranger to the celebrations, having won the NTA for Best Judge three times.

He revealed he was excited to take on the new presenting role, saying: "I am thrilled to be the new host of the NTAs - and will ensure I also win them all."

Kim Turberville, NTA creator and executive producer added: "Our host is the brilliant David Walliams .

(Image: Twitter)

"David is a man of so many talents - a comedian, actor, best-selling author, TV judge and charity fundraising hero…

"And we look forward to him now being the NTA’s Celebrator-in-Chief in this very special year."

In 2012, David also won the NTA's Landmark Achievement Award, which celebrated the star's TV and charity successes.

After successfully presenting the show, which celebrates the nation’s favourite TV shows and stars, for ten years Dermot decided to take a step back.

(Image: ITV)

He announced the news of his departure with his Instagram followers in February. He wrote: "After 10 years of proudly hosting the National Television Awards, I have decided it’s time to step down as host.

"It’s been a tough decision because we have had a ball over the last decade, but 10 years feels about right.

"I would like to thank Indigo and my ITV family for a brilliant ten years and look forward to proudly passing on the baton in 2020… and a holiday in January!"

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

(Image: ITV)

David is currently preparing for the Britain's Got Talent: The Champion's finale , which takes place on Saturday night.

The show will see the final ten acts perform for one more time in hope of taking home the coveted trophy.

Finalists include fan favourite Stavros Flatley , dancing duo Twist and Pulse as well as rappers Bars and Melody.

The 2020 National Television Awards will air on ITV on January 28, 2020.
description: David Walliams is ‘thrilled’ to be hosting the 2020 National Television Awards, after Dermot O’Leary stepped down earlier this year
